servinfo.title: DTC P1431: Clogged Diesel Particulate Filter Failures

item.ptxt: After servicing, explain to the customer that it is necessary to regenerate the diesel particulate filter when diesel particulate filter warning light is lit in order to avoid unnecessary repairs.
To regenerate the diesel particulate, customer must drive the vehicle until the light goes out, at a speed of 75 km/h (47 mph) or higher for a while (max. 30 minutes).
If diesel particulate filter is replaced, be sure to initialize diesel particulate filter data in ECM.
For details, refer to Diesel Particulate Filter Data Initialization:F9Q .
Conditions for applying fault finding procedures to stored faults:
The fault is declared present after the engine is started or following a road test.
Diesel particulate filter regenerations are inhibited.
The Injection warning light (gravity 1 warning light) is lit.
The fault appears if the weight of soot contained in the filter is greater than 52 g.

entry.ptxt: Check if DTC P0470 is detected.
If DTC P0470 is present, proceed to its troubleshooting.
Check the condition of the following pressure pipes:

item.ptxt: Differential pressure sensor downstream side pipe if necessary.

entry.ptxt: Carry out diesel particulate filter after-sales regeneration referring to Diesel Particulate Filter After-Sales Regeneration Procedure:F9Q .
If after-sales regeneration is NOT correctly performed, follow the instruction.
If the fault is still present, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
